author: Amrut Katigar
comment: How about adding a new features like 1) smart sleep alarm, 2) adding a watch face for moto 360, where in user can get the data right on their watch face,  no need to access the app everytime 3) automatically understanding workout mode in the background, 4) sleep hours detection, ability to access heart rate data on website. 5) move your body triggering through smart watch vibration, which will make alert to a user to switch their body position or have a walk after a long time of sitting.

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Thank you for all the feature ideas. These will be added to the feature list which you can see at the Google+ community. You can access the community from the left panel in the app.

author: Mads Hagemann Nielsen
comment: The automatic measure does not work at all. I have now been using it for 5 days. And only stores the data when I go into the app and press measure.. I have seen that it activates the pulse reading due to the green LEDs are blinking, but no data is recorded. What to do? I have a Ticwatch E

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for getting in touch. There is an issue with automatic monitoring on Ticwatch at present. This is being worked ok. Join the Google+ Heart Trace community to hear first when a beta version is out with the fix.

author: Steven Lawler
comment: Add in an option for 24 hour monitoring. Right now I stop it at 11:59 and Start at 12:00. Also there seems to be huge gaps in time period when this app is inactive. Not sure if its on the watch side or the phone side. Seems to happen an hour after the app was last opened. I'm using the new Tic Watch. Also the exported rows should save to the second, not minute.

author: Lucas Kara
comment: This is a pretty phenomenal app!!! Ive purchased 2 other heart rate apps, but this one works so damn well, and look so damn nice! I'm gunna purchase just to support the dev! Nice job, amazing app!

author: Kenneth Yu
comment: Excellent app, exactly what I was after - simple, clean, nice graphs for scheduled heart rate monitoring. Working great with my Huawei Watch.

author: Tom Shanahan
comment: This is a very high quality app. By far the best I have used for monitoring heart rate. Great work. Would be great feature to have alerts on high heart rate.

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback, glad you like Heart Trace. Look out for the updated version coming very soon or join the beta test to get access to new features first.

author: aaron ridgley
comment: Great app but would be really good if it could alert to unusual reading based on historical data or abnormally high reading.

author: Sam Burton
comment: OMG! These guys got all of it right. Live, constant monitoring mode for workouts. Reads every ten seconds or so. All of the other necessary settings are adjustable. Love this app. Thanks devs and I just made a donation. Peace!

author: Mark Potter
comment: Automatic checks don't seem to work. Manual checks are great. I have a Tickwatch S.

author: Avinash G A
comment: Awesome App. Love the settings and ability to sync to Google fit. Must have with smart watch. It deserves five stars

author: Markus Greb
comment: Absolutely awesome till now. Tracked whole night and only drained battery by about 2% at my LG Sport Watch. Way better than Google Fit.

author: Chad McElligott
comment: Does exactly what I want. Detailed heart rate monitoring from my Huawei Watch 2 with syncing into Google Fit. Simple but right on the money.

author: Shubhadeep Chaudhuri
comment: This is a great app. But can't it sync sports mode readings with Google fit?

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Being able to record your sports mode sessions and sync them with Google Fit is on the roadmap.  You can find out more at the Heart Trace Google+ community. There is a link to the community in the phone app in the left nav panel.

author: Saahir Kapasi
comment: It works great! I wonder if you could get Samsung health integration as well, it would be very beneficial

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Samsung health integration in on the feature tracker. You can see the feature tracker at the Heart Trace Google+ community. There's a link to the community in the phone app in the left navigation panel.

author: Adam Hsieh
comment: Automatic HR sampling doesn't work...

author: Willie Germann
comment: Does not work on LG watches

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback and sorry Heart Trace isn't working as expected for you. Can you email magic09.apps@gmail.com with details of the smart watch you have and I'll look into this for you.

author: Michael Barker
comment: I like it it has simple but great functionality

author: Roy Turner
comment: Impressed, tried a few similar apps and this one was the best of the bunch for me. Nice work developer.

author: Nathan Notley
comment: Really great interval features and gap monitoring. Works perfectly and the data summaries are easy to read

author: Intan H
comment: The app does not appear on my moto 360

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. If you have Android Wear 2.0 you will need to install on your phone, access the Play Store on your watch then scroll to the bottom and install the Heart Trace Android Wear app. Please email magic09.apps@gmail.com if you need any further help.

author: Michael Sacco
comment: Just what I was looking for... Works perfect with my Huawei watch (1st Gen)

author: Alexandru Topală
comment: You can see there's lots of effort put into this app

author: Ville-Petteri Ukonaho
comment: Just what I need a continuous heart rate monitoring app.

author: Justin Barrada
comment: Exactly what I wanted! Perfect app.

author: Eddie Padilla
comment: This is exactly what Google fit is missing.

author: Carlos Irizarry
comment: Reading doesn't show up.

author: Staf Heyndrickx
comment: Pretty good...

author: Dennis LuPresto
comment: This app is exactly what my Android Wear was missing. I switched from a fit bit to Android Wear about 6 months ago and the heart rate history throughout the day was the biggest miss on the wear device.  This app addresses that issue and syncs with Google fit. I couldn't be happier.

author: T.J. Nilon
comment: Saw this app mentioned on Reddit and decided to give it a try. I'm running an LG G Watch R on Android 1.5, and this app works PHENOMENALLY! What actually drove me over the edge and caused me to write this review was that I was reviewing my heart rate overnight last night, and I saw it jump to over 100 for 2 consecutive polling sessions and then go bank to normal. It actually DETECTED that I had a nightmare. So cool!!

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback and glad to hear that Heart Trace is working really well for you.  I'd be really interested to see the Reddit page if you still have the link?  If you do could you send to magic09.apps@gmail.com, thanks.

author: Shaun Kenyon
comment: Great app, love the data integration with Google fit. The regular monitoring function works perfectly and the level of control over frequency of measurements and accuracy is great. If you want to use sport mode ensure that the measurement accuracy is set to standard or low to allow for rapid updates. Using OnePlus3 + LG Urbane  EDIT: edited review after developer contacted me and solved the issue of slow update rates in sport mode - which in itself shows great support from the developer :-)

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Can you email magic09.apps@gmail.com with details of the smartwatch you're using. Sports mode should provide the first reading in under 10 seconds and update every few seconds.

author: Maarten Van Giel
comment: Awesome app. Works better and looks better than other paid alternatives. Only thing I'd love to see is a complication that could show your latest heart rate on your watchface but hey for a free app I'm definitely not complaining.

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Look out for Android Wear complications coming soon.

author: Dino Švragulja
comment: This app is awesome for tracking your heart rate. I'm using it on my Huawei watch 2 with no problems whatsoever and it displays data much better than the default Huawei app. I recommend implementing heart rate zones to make it even better :)

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content:
Hi, thanks for the feedback. Your suggestion had been added to the feature list. You can see the feature list at the Heart Trace Google+ community:
https://plus.google.com/communities/101781392757311833259

author: Zayd Shaikh
comment: Just what I needed for continuos heart rate monitoring from my watch. Stable, accurate and lovely interface. I'd recommend donating as the dev has clearly put in a lot of work!

author: Mike Morley
comment: Thought would give this another look but still no improvement as it still doesn't function properly on Huawei watch. 3 manual checks and only 1 worked, heart rate monitor works fine so not issue with watch

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the updated feedback. Sorry Heart Trace doesn't seem to be working for you. There's a few updates coming over the next few weeks which may fix this. Also coming is an Android Wear 2.0 standalone version.

author: Francisco Javier Carvajal López
comment: You need this if you want accurate info on google fit. Heart rate monitoring seems disabled now both in google fit and moto body!

author: Paul Cahill
comment: Love the new sport mode on my Moto 360 sport.

author: Simon Alderson
comment: Simple, intuitive and easy to use but.. as I have a low resting heartrate it gets confused when my pulse drops to around 40bpm so doubles the reading, presumably as it thinks it is erroneous. Please fix!

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. You can reduce/remove this error by in settings increasing the Heart rate accuracy to high and/or increasing Minimum heart rate readings to 5 or 10. Please email magic09.apps@gmail.com for more guidance.

author: Richard Newton
comment: The developer quickly responded to me regarding my issue and through troubleshooting he/she helped me resolve my issue. I love this app.  Can we get an option to disable the vibration of when it is measuring the heart rate? If so I will rate 5 stars

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the update. You can disable vibration using the Heart beat vibration option in settings.

author: moveit124
comment: Stopped working on LG Urbane 2, application can't sync with watch.  Watch can take the heart rate.  Can send data to watch but not receive (pressing button on phone makes watch take heart rate).

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Please can you email magic09.apps@gmail.com for support.

author: Ethan Hartman
comment: Great way to get periodic measurements of heart rate, something that my Huawei watch does not do automatically. Google Fit integration is great. I wasn't able manually get it to measure heart rate, otherwise I would give 5 stars.

reply.author: magic09 applications
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Please can you email magic09.apps@gmail.com with details of your smartwatch.
